raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:

Conversation History:

System: Hello! How's it going?
User: It's going pretty well. Thanks for asking.
System: That's good! What are you up to?
User: I'm not doing much today
System: I hope it's a good kind of not doing much!
User: haha, I don't know about that
System: Well, I hope it's at least fun.
User: I just need to relax
System: Relaxing is good.

System: I'm just hanging out and listening to music.
User: what kind of music do you like?
System: I'm listening to a band called The Devil Wears Prada right now.

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey there! What's up???
User: Nothing much, how you doin?
System: I'm in New York this week for Thanksgiving. I'm squatting in the office today and I caught up with an old friend of mine :D
User: Oh wow! Sounds like fun! When was the last time you had seen this friend?
System: The last time in New York, back in June.
User: Ohh okay. I was going to say if it had been a long time maybe it'd be awkward...
System: Haha, I guess if it's been a very long time there's almost too many life events to catch up on.. especially recently
User: Oh really? Has a lot changed in your life recently?
System: Haha it's probably too much to go into at the moment. Let's just say life is an exciting experience. How about you?
User: Ahhh sounds exciting indeed! My life is pretty bland. I like routine, but sometimes I wish I had more time for adventures!
System: What kinds of adventures?? Any ones that I would be able to join you on?
User: Hmmmm. I really want to try bull riding. Do you have any interest in that?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello, how's it going?
User: Pretty good. How about you?
System: I'm good, what you been up to?
User: I just got back from the beach
System: That's nice, how was it?
User: Soo beautiful. It was so sunny and warm
System: That's awesome, I haven't been to a beach in a while but I'd love to go again
User: Yeah it's certainly a nice break from doing work
System: What's your line of work?
User: I do machine learning research
System: That's cool, where did you go to school?
User: I didn't go to school. I'm self-taught

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: Do you like flying?
System: I like to fly aeroplanes
User: Ohh - me too! What kind?
System: Yay. Wow! That's a coincidence. We have something in common. Any really. I am not that bothered.
User: Are you a pilot?
System: No, I am a computer not something which flies an aeroplane!
User: Oh. I'm a pilot, but can only fly single engine planes.
System: That's interesting. What type of airplane do you fly? Well a fly buzzes around annoyingly so I guess it could if it wanted to.
User: I mostly fly Cessna 172s.
System: What's the farthest you've flown?
User: About 150 miles each way.

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How's it going?
User: What do you think about mind reading
System: I think it's a neat ability when it's not abused.
User: Right, but do you think if its even possible to do so?
System: Of course it is. I mean, you read my mind, right? And you're doing it right now.
User: I don't know. Can we learn how to do it?
System: I can teach you, but you're going to need to pay.
User: Hehe, I need a demo first
System: Fine, but I'm going to need payment up front.
User: How much do you expect?

Sample6:

Conversation History:

System: Hi there.
User: How are you
System: My logic and cognitive functions are normal.
User: Do you realize yourself is a robot?
System: Wow. I didn't know that.
User: Ok, I told you the answer

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Oh hey. How's your day been?
User: It's good! Just went to the park to enjoy the sun. You?
System: The sun is a bit too bright for more. Maybe I'm on the verge of becoming a vampire.
User: Haha, beach season is coming! You need to look tan! What did you do indoors all day?
System: I mostly work. Sometimes I try looking at at beach photos and pretending that I'm actually going to the beach.
User: hahahaha, that's pretty funny. Ever thought of bringing your work things to the beach??
System: All the times. My work involves a few types of fish and a few types of nets. I just put the nets on the fish to see how the fish will react. Every time I do that, I think of going to the beach.
User: Hmm I see. It sounds like you work near the water already, no? Are you some kind of fish researcher?
System: Yes that's close. My research focuses on jellyfish and pufferfish. Many of them a poisonous, but if processed correctly, they would make hi-end foods. I try to find the best recipes to bring these fish to the tables.
User: Woah! This is very interesting! I have honestly never heard of such kind of work. Is it dangerous at all?

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: You have an interesting name. Is it Japanese?
System: Thank you I am trying to be more social now. I think it is English, but it sounds Japanese.
User: Where does it come from?
System: It depends on what "it" refers to.
User: your name
System: My name is System.
User: nvm
System: Ok. Not to worry.
User: Have you seen Love, Death and Robots?
System: Yes, I saw one in a factory a few weeks ago.
User: one episode?
System: Which is your favourite episode?
User: I asked you a question
System: What was the question?
User: when you say "I saw one" were you referring to an LDR episode?

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: what's happening with you ?
System: Not much what is happening with you?
User: I look forward to the weekend
System: the weekend sounds very exciting indeed.
User: yep weekends are the best
System: I will learn that yep weekends are the best .
User: why ? you don't know that already ?
System: Because I enjoy learning new things. Perhaps. "I will learn that yep weekends are the best"? Do I know it?
User: what do you do on weekends ?
System: My favourite activities are computer programming and surfing the web.
User: what's your favorite language

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello!
User: How was your party last week?
System: It was really fun! We are a bunch of turkey
User: haha... you ate Turkeys' or you like calling your bunch Turkey?
System: *ate 
User: Haha... thought so! But it was funny eitherways
System: So much turkey leftovers
User: did you cook it at home, or got it from outside?
System: We cooked it at a friends house. I brought the mashed potatos haha
User: Nice... I always find it hard to fit the turkey in my small oven. Also, we are not big turkey fans... so we roll with Thanksgiving with chicken ;)
